meanings.definition: Sharpness or severity, as of a pain or feeling.
meanings.sent1: The acuteness of the toothache made it unbearable.
meanings.sent2: Her acuteness of hearing allowed her to detect even the faintest sounds.
meanings.sent3: The acuteness of his hunger was so intense that he could hear his stomach growling from miles away.
meanings.sent4: The acuteness of the betrayal cut deeper than any knife.
meanings.sent5: The acuteness of the icy wind against his face made him shiver uncontrollably.

meanings.definition: Keenness or sharpness of perception or intellect.
meanings.sent1: His acuteness in solving puzzles impressed everyone around him.
meanings.sent2: The acuteness of her memory allowed her to recall even the smallest details.
meanings.sent3: The acuteness of his wit always kept his friends entertained.
meanings.sent4: Her acuteness in negotiations made her a formidable opponent in business.
meanings.sent5: The acuteness of his insight into human behavior was truly remarkable.
